title: To the Sea
lines: I call upon gray-eyed Tethys, bride of Okeanos, dark-veiled queen whose waves dance as they are blown onto the land by the sweet breezes.
You break your tall waves upon the rocky beaches, you are calmed by races that are gentle and smooth, you delight in ships, your waters feed wild beasts.
Mother of Kypris, mother of dark clouds, mother of every spring round which nymphs swarm, hear me, O holy one, please help, send a fair tail wind to ships, O blessed one.
